command: WITHHELD_FOR_SAFETY - mshta variant: UNC path HTA on SMB share invoked from PowerShell
explanation: Demonstrates mshta loading HTA content via a UNC path, using a network share to proxy execution under a trusted signed binary.
rationale_steps: PowerShell executes mshta with a UNC target pointing to an HTA on a share
mshta fetches and runs content from the remote share within its trusted context
This can subvert controls that allow signed binary execution but do not constrain content source
Defenders should flag PowerShell->mshta parent-child with network/UNC paths and .hta artifacts
Enforce network-aware application control and restrict script host access to remote shares

llm_judgments.semantic_justification: Using mshta to load an HTA over a UNC path is operationally plausible but aligns with Signed Binary Proxy Execution (T1218.005), not System Script Proxy Execution (T1216).

llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The described technique of using mshta.exe to load an HTA file from a UNC path aligns perfectly with T1216 (System Script Proxy Execution) as it leverages a trusted Microsoft binary to proxy execution of potentially malicious content.
